metadata.title: Getting Started — Connect Your Project in 5 Minutes
metadata.description: How to connect your project via MCP from Claude Code or Cursor and start AI-powered learning. From API key setup to your first tech stack analysis.

hero.title: VibeUniv Getting Started Guide
hero.description: Follow along step by step to connect your project and start AI-powered learning. No worries if you're new!

step0.title: Before You Start
step0.intro: You just need these 3 things to get started.
step0.check1: AI Coding Tool — Claude Code, Cursor, Windsurf, Cline, Kimi Code, or OpenAI Codex installed
step0.check2: An AI-Built Project — The project folder you want to analyze should be on your local machine
step0.check3: LLM API Key — API key for Anthropic, OpenAI, Google, etc. (for Pro plan BYOK; not needed for Free plan)

step1.title: Sign Up & Log In
step1.description: Sign up with your email at <signupLink>vibeuniv.com/signup</signupLink>. Already have an account? Just <loginLink>log in</loginLink>.

step2.title: Register LLM API Key (Optional)
step2.description: To use BYOK (Bring Your Own Key) on Pro plan or above, register your LLM API key. If you're on the Free plan, you can skip this step.
step2.ol1: 1. After logging in, go to Settings > LLM Keys
step2.ol3: 3. Enter your API key and save
step2.info: Your keys are encrypted with AES-256-GCM before storage. VibeUniv never stores keys in plaintext or sends them externally.

step3.title: Generate VibeUniv API Key
step3.description: The MCP server needs a VibeUniv API key to link projects to your account.
step3.ol3: 3. Copy the generated key and store it somewhere safe
step3.warning: The API key is shown only once after creation. Make sure to copy it! If lost, you'll need to generate a new one.

step4.title: Connect MCP Server
step4.description: Add the MCP server configuration to your AI coding tool. The config file path varies by tool.

cline.description: In VS Code, open Cline > MCP Servers > Edit Config and add the following.

kimiCode.cliDescription: Or add directly via CLI: manage MCP servers with kimi mcp and check connection status with /mcp.

codex.cliDescription: Or add with a single CLI command:
codex.projectNote: For project-specific settings, add to .codex/config.toml (project root). Both CLI and IDE extension share the same config file.

step4.info: If editing config files manually is difficult, just ask your AI coding tool to do it. For example, tell Claude Code "Add vibeuniv to MCP server settings" or tell Cursor "Add this config to mcp.json" — the AI will find and update the config file for you. Paste the JSON config code above for best results!

step5.title: Sync Your Project
step5.description: Once you've saved the MCP config, follow these steps.
step5.ol1: 1. Fully quit and restart your AI coding tool
step5.ol2: 2. In your project folder, ask the AI to call vibeuniv_sync_project
step5.ol3: 3. Check the VibeUniv dashboard to confirm the project is registered
step5.info: Sync only transmits config files and source code structure. Sensitive files like .env and certificates are automatically excluded.

step6.title: Tech Stack Analysis
step6.description: Once your project is registered, AI can analyze your tech stack.
step6.method1: Method 1: Open your project in the dashboard and click the "Analyze" button
step6.method2: Method 2: Call the vibeuniv_analyze MCP tool from your AI tool
step6.result: Once analysis is complete, you can see frameworks, libraries, and architecture patterns at a glance.

step7.title: Start Learning!
step7.description: After analysis, the really fun part begins.
step7.ol1: 1. Go to the Learning tab of your project
step7.ol2: 2. Review the AI-generated personalized learning roadmap
step7.ol3: 3. Start learning module by module based on your code
step7.conclusion: Not abstract tutorials — your own code becomes your textbook.

restApi.title: Connect via REST API Without MCP
restApi.description: If you can't use MCP, you can send your project directly via REST API. All you need is an API key.
restApi.projectIdComment: # Use the project ID from the response
restApi.conclusion: Once analysis is complete, you can view results in the dashboard and generate a learning roadmap.

0.title: MCP server won't connect
0.item1: Check that the config file JSON format is valid (commas, braces, etc.)
0.item2: Make sure the VIBEUNIV_API_KEY value is correct
0.item3: Check that Node.js is installed (npx is required)
0.item4: Fully quit and restart your AI coding tool

1.title: Project doesn't appear in dashboard
1.item2: Make sure the API key belongs to the correct account
1.item3: Refresh the dashboard in your browser

2.title: Analysis fails
2.item1: Check that the project has dependency files like package.json or requirements.txt
2.item2: If using BYOK, verify that the registered LLM API key is valid
2.item3: Try again later — it might be a temporary LLM provider error

3.title: I was using VIBESTACK_API_KEY before
3.item2: We recommend switching to VIBEUNIV_API_KEY when you have time

security.title: Security

collected.title: Files We Collect
collected.item4: Source code (.ts, .tsx, .py, etc. — up to 50 files)

security.info: All data is transmitted via HTTPS and LLM API keys are encrypted with AES-256-GCM. You can completely delete your project data at any time.
